intro: Epidendrum trachychilum, commonly known as the silver-leaf epidendrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery-white underside, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or green with red or purple markings, arranged in a raceme. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
